title: Implementing Zero-Trust Security in Financial Services
excerpt: A practical guide to zero-trust architecture for fintech companies.
body:
## Beyond Perimeter Security

The traditional castle-and-moat security model is dead. In a world of cloud services, remote work, and API-first architectures, zero-trust is the only viable approach.

## Core Principles

### Never Trust, Always Verify

Every request must be authenticated and authorized, regardless of source.

### Least Privilege Access

Grant minimum necessary permissions, just-in-time.

### Assume Breach

Design systems assuming attackers are already inside.

## Implementation Roadmap

### Phase 1: Identity Foundation

- Strong identity provider
- MFA everywhere
- Service identities for machines

### Phase 2: Network Segmentation

- Micro-segmentation
- Service mesh with mTLS
- Network policies

### Phase 3: Continuous Verification

- Real-time risk assessment
- Behavioral analytics
- Automated response

## Financial Services Considerations

- Regulatory requirements (PCI-DSS, SOC2)
- Third-party vendor access
- Customer data protection

## Conclusion

Zero-trust is a journey, not a destination. Start with identity and iterate.
